item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: The Supreme Court dealt Argentina a setback in its long-running battle with creditors, heightening the risk of a default by the country.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Siemens and Mitsubishi launched a bid for Alstom's energy business, aiming to thwart GE's $17 billion offer for the French group.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: Alibaba released new details of its business ahead of its IPO, including a sales breakdown and names of people who control board nominations.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: The IMF predicted U.S. inflation will remain below a 2% target through 2017 and said rates should stay near zero even longer than investors expect.

stub.title: What's News: Business & Finance
stub.description: The British pound topped $1.70 for the first time in nearly five years on bets the Bank of England will raise rates.

stub.title: What's News: Business & Finance
stub.description: EU inflation fell to a 0.6% rate, boosting expectations that more central banks in the bloc will provide stimulus.

stub.title: What's News: Business & Finance
stub.description: The Dow edged up 5.27 points to 16781.01 as investors weighed Iraqi turmoil against economic data and deals.

stub.title: What's News: Business & Finance
stub.description: GM pushed its repair-cost estimate for this year to $2 billion as it disclosed plans to replace ignition keys.

stub.title: What's News: Business & Finance
stub.description: States and cities would have to add retiree-benefit promises to their balance sheets under an accounting proposal.

stub.title: What's News: Business & Finance
stub.description: Internet provider Level 3 agreed to buy rival TW Telecom for about $5.7 billion.

stub.title: What's News: Business & Finance
stub.description: Boeing said U.S. and European regulators approved its larger Dreamliner model.
